abstract: Setting ground rules for competition is one thing, but seeking to determine outcomes is another. In European antitrust, there is more a doctrine of “reining in” powerful companies than in the United States
snippet: Setting ground rules for competition is one thing, but seeking to determine outcomes is another. In European antitrust, there is more a doctrine of “reining in” powerful companies than in the United States
lead_paragraph: Microsoft, once again, is in the crosshairs of European antitrust regulators, but major American technology companies have to wonder whether this will stop with Microsoft.

headline.main: The European Challenge to Successful Companies
